content.en: Speaker recognition: Researchers have been exploring the use of algorithms to improve speaker recognition accuracy. They have developed various deep neural architectures, such as DNA and NPC, that can learn speaker-specific characteristics from acoustic representations. These algorithms, along with feature fusion and deep neural networks, are replacing traditional methods in speaker verification and identification. Additionally, models combining 3D convolutional neural networks and LSTM, as well as CNN-based models, are being used to improve speaker recognition in the presence of interference.
content.da: Talergenkendelse: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af algoritmer for at forbedre nøjagtigheden af talergenkendelse. De har udviklet forskellige dybe neurale arkitekturer, såsom DNA og NPC, der kan lære taler-specifikke karakteristika fra akustiske repræsentationer. Disse algoritmer, sammen med feature fusion og dybe neurale netværk, erstatter traditionelle metoder i talerevaluer og identifikation. Derudover bruges modeller, der kombinerer 3D konvolutionelle neurale netværk og LSTM, samt CNN-baserede modeller, til at forbedre talergenkendelse i nærvær af interferens.
